meanings.definition: To strike with an open hand.
meanings.sent1: She was slapping the table to get everyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: The kids were slapping high-fives after winning the game.
meanings.sent3: The clown was slapping his own face in a silly dance routine.
meanings.sent4: The wind was slapping the curtains against the window.
meanings.sent5: The chef was slapping the dough to make it smooth and stretchy.

meanings.definition: The act of striking with an open hand.
meanings.sent1: The loud slapping sound echoed through the room.
meanings.sent2: I could hear the slapping of hands in the distance.
meanings.sent3: The slapping of the waves against the shore was calming.
meanings.sent4: The slapping of the ruler on the desk signaled the end of class.
meanings.sent5: The slapping of the wet towel against the wall left marks.
